Question: How can I select a walk route?
Answer: To select a walk, go to Main Menu > Browser and select which walk you wish to do. Each walk contains additional information regarding its historic value. After reviewing and identifying the a walk, tap the map button to select it.

Question: How can I learn more about a landmark?
Answer: To learn more about a landmark, tap it from the map. This will show a small dialog box revealing the name of the landmark, and a small snippet of infromation about it. Taping on the dialog box will show more information regarding the landmark.

Question: How do I know where I am on the map?
Answer: To find your live location in Manly, tap the button located on the top right corner of the map.

Question: What do the Normal, Satellite, and Terrain buttons do?
Answer: These buttons, located at the bottom of the map, change the map type. Normal displays the map in a way that is easier to view streets and roads. Satellite displays an acutal satellite view of Manly, to better distinguish residential and natural/wild land. Terrain may be used to see elevations in land.

Question: How do you zoom in and out?
Answer: To zoom in and out on the map, use two fingers to pinch on the screen (similar to the Google Maps function). Use this to get a closer look into streets and locations in Manly.
